intro: Alyssum stipitatum, commonly known as the clustered alyssum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. The plant has compact, mat-forming growth habit with dense clusters of flowers on slender stems. Its foliage consists of small, narrow leaves that are usually gray-green in color. Alyssum stipitatum is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
